themes: Need for specialized support for non-profit arts vs. broader creative industries
Development of non-profit performing arts infrastructure
Diversification of public funding sources beyond HOT
Support for arts education and community participation
key_phrases: lumping all creative industries together is not helpful or supportive to the non-profit arts field
developing the needed non-profit performing arts infrastructure
find additional public funding sources outside of HOT
support initiatives that supports arts education and participation by placing artists in schools, after school programs in rec centers, churches
barriers_identified: Lack of non-profit performing arts infrastructure
solutions_proposed: Develop non-profit performing arts infrastructure (scene shops, costume shops, studios, affordable performance spaces for mature artists)
Find additional public funding sources outside of HOT
Support arts education and participation by placing artists in schools, after school programs, and churches
